title: Ethiopia | International Crisis Group
snippet: Electoral authorities 17 Nov invited candidates to register for general elections – tentatively set for 1 June 2026 – despite concerns that security conditions in Oromia and Amhara regions, alongside political dispute with Tigray, could prevent voting in large parts of country, undermining poll’s credibility. Continue reading · 10 Dec 2025 There’s a possibility of mistakes or miscalculation [between Ethiopia and Eritrea], and the situation could deteriorate further in the coming months.

title: Ethiopia situation update (5 March 2025) | ACLED
snippet: In January, numerous Tigray security force senior leaders openly sided with Debretsion (for more on the internal dispute, see EPO Monthly Update: October 2024 and Ethiopia Situation Update (5 February 2025)). Since the signing of a peace agreement between the Oromia regional government and a faction of Oromo Liberation Army (OLA) — referred to by the government as the Oromo Liberation Front (OLF)-Shane — on 1 December 2024, political violence has been decreasing in the region (for more, see Ethiopia Weekly Update (10 December 2024), Ethiopia Weekly Update (17 December 2024); Ethiopia Situation Update (5 February 2025), and Ethiopia Situation Update (19 February 2025)).

title: The Habesha: Trusted Ethiopian News & In-Depth Analysis
